page.title: 17INDUSTRY AROUND STAINLAND
page.content: Some of the fabric is exported to Denmark and much of the rest is bought by caravan companies. {T.P.T.} T.P.T. is a paper mill.They recycle waste paper and make the cardboard that is used to make paper tubes. They employ around 160 local people.They use a shift system and work the mill 24 hours a day,seven days a week.Each shift consists of 40 men. T.P.T.stands for Textile Paper Tubes, but the tubes are not made at Stainland, they are made in Lancashire.Lorries arrive throughout the day loaded with bales of waste paper.Each bale weighs 3/4 of a tonne, and each lorry carries around 20 tonnes. The waste paper is put into a large vat and made into pulp.
